html: As a result of the end-time ministry of Jehovah’s servant, the long-standing enmity between Ephraim, the birthright tribe, and Judah, the ruling tribe (Genesis 48:11-19; 49:8-12; 1 Chronicles 5:2), dissipates. As David united the northern and southern tribes of Israel (2 Samuel 5:1-5), so does Jehovah’s servant. Growing into one nation in Jehovah’s hand, they exist no more as a divided people (Ezekiel 37:15-28). When empowered by Jehovah’s hand, of deliverance, they conquer their enemies who surround them (Isaiah 41:10-16; 49:17) as Israel did anciently under David (2 Samuel 8:11-14).
